reviews.review_msg: Isabel made learning Spanish easy. She is really nice and cares about her students' success. If you are there because you really want to learn Spanish she will go out of her way to help you. Quizzes were very straightforward and no surprises.

Isabel is an incredible teacher, and she clearly adores her recurring students. She & Carolina Lemay have cultivated the best class environments I've ever been in. The structure of her classes is straightforward and effective, and it's obvious in everything she does that she wants her students to thrive.

She's a good prof but went on a tangent twice about how people should be thankful for the Mexico we have today & Spain gave them the culture and language we have now? Which isn't rlly wrong but ignores the entire destruction of Indigenous communities and their deaths?? Idk some underlying racist tones were coming thru and it's unfortunate.

Amazing course, totally recommend! However, even though it is listed as an introductory course, having some previous experience with spanish is what will benefit you the most. Lots of memorization of words and grammar concepts, but you it pays off when you can actually learn the language. TA's are super passionate and helpful

I took SPAN110 with Isabel and loved it! She is very heavy on language immersion, and speaks in Spanish for the majority of class. We had a quiz every other week and regular online activities. Isabel is warm, encouraging, and dedicated. Don't take her classes if you don't care about actually learning the language; she won't tolerate that.
This class was pretty fun. Interactive. I'd recommend it, Isabel is great also.
I liked this class.

Literally have no bad things to say about Isabel. She's caring, insightful, and puts a lot of effort into making classes interesting and engaging. I'd recommend her to anyone looking to work on their Spanish.

Fantastic professor. First time I've ever had a prof encourage you to reach out for extra help and actually mean it. Classes are fun, prof is caring and engaging, and the textbook is pretty straightforward.

throughout all of my degree, Isabel's spanish classes were the ones I was consistently looking forward to. she makes learning fun and interactive and is always willing to help students outside of class hours. highly recommend!!!!

ISABEL ES LA MEJOR!!!!! seriously though, she has helped me improve my spanish more than i ever thought was possible. she is so caring, funny, and really enjoys teaching her language-- it shows! its not an easy class but if you work hard she makes it possible to estn a high grade.

This prof. is absolutely amazing! I was always looking forward to her Spanish class. She is very easy-going, making you feel comfortable during classes. As I am very shy person, feeling comfortable making mistakes in front of others was a big plus. She is also very caring about her students and you can tell she truly enjoys teaching.

A great and caring prof! I took 4 courses with Isabel and would take more if I could. Isabel grades fairly. The classes are not too easy nor too hard! Classes are fun and interesting, and Isabel explains concepts clearly and concisely. I would definitely take her classes again.

I took Spanish for 4 years before taking this course so it was really easy for me. She explains concepts and takes feedback well. A very easy marker on tests, but gives out seemingly random participation marks. Will not move on if she calls you and you don't know the answer (it's painful). She is very nice & understanding & a native Spanish speaker
Isabel is such a good professor. She explains things clearly, marks fairly, and most of all she treats her students with respect and wants them to succeed. Would definitely take again!
Amazing lady. Very friendly and good at explaining. Participation is mandatory, as well as attendance. But if you put in the hard work, she will go the extra mile for you.
I loved this class. Most of the movies were great, with some exceptions. You have to participate in online discussions, which takes time, but I really like to read others opinions.
Isabel is great. She is always accessible and willing to help. Her tests are not easy, but they are fair. She was very a very knowledgable instructor. She is very clear and organized!!

This online class was a lot of work. Do not take it if you are looking for something easy.  She is really helpful if you need to clarify or ask questions. She's a great prof, very approachable and lovely. I was going through a hard time and you won't believe how comprehensive she is towards students. She definitely wants us so succeed.

It was a good class because I dont have time to go to campus... I had to study every week, though. I liked the material and textbook. Isabel was very helpful,.. you have to prepare your questions before having a session with her.

She is great, but this class is a lot of work. I found it hard to keep up. She offered lots of help and did one-on-one sessions with me, which made a huge difference. I would take another class with her, but I would not do Spanish online -- you just don't get to experience the language the same way.

SPN 110 online was easy, not too much work. Just keep up with exercises (there's a bit, but they're all easy) and you'll fly through this course no sweat. She's super helpful and grades easy. No assignments, only chapter quizzes (9 of them) and oral exam and final, which was all fair

This course is not an easy-credit course. I studied almost everyday for 20 mins. and I got an A. Lesson tests are not hard  but you have to pass the final exam, which is hard but fair. If you like to interact with other students, you rather take this course on campus.  Isabel is very helpful and responds to all your questions. She is very accesible

This class was soooo much work. Hours and hours every week, much more than any of my other classes. Makes you think twice about taking it online, or taking it with this prof. She seemed less helpful than with the prior semester. Also the oral exam is tons of work for very little percentage. Overall wouldn't recommend this class or this prof.

This online class was a lot of work. Do not take it if you are looking for something easy. You have to put in a lot of effort and complete all the activities. She is really helpful if you need to clarify or ask questions. She expects you to work hard.
She is such a friendly and helpful professor, always there to help with questions. The course was very well-organized and fair.
It was a busy course. Many small assignments to do. Tests were fair. Isabel always answered all questions and gave me prompt and useful feedbacks. If you study everyday, it  is a good online course.

I took this course bcuz her rating was really good. But I regret so much. The course load is very busy. You have a lot of assignment and not easy quiz almost once in a week. And also there is a oral test and you should get more than 50% in the final otherwise you will fail this course. She expects too much from you. Don't take this course.

Okay I read all the comments below and took this class.sit there and submit online assignments. But Quizes are hard and so is everything else.BUT its sooo much work. you are expected to make sentences. And spanish language is vast and hard. Trust me you dont want to take this course if you dont know previous spanish. I am regretting it now
Very easy Distance Ed. course although bit time consuming due to too many small assignments. She is very helpful and encouraging. Quizzes are fairly easy.

Pretty easy to get a good mark on the Distance Ed if you put in the work. Never spoke a word of Spanish in my life before taking it and did really well. Completing the assignments on time is MANDATORY, online assignments are worth 60% of your mark. First 2 quizzes easy, but final was harder as there was a ton of verbs, vocab + grammar to remember.

She is a very encouraging prof.. an essential characteristic as a language teacher. Won't upset you even if you are dumb! She wants the students to do well.. and it shows. No exam, but four big tests that are on the computer which are tough. With a little bit of studying you can get really good marks. Textbooks explains everything really well.

I took 102/103 with Isabel, both classes were great! She's very helpful, nice and willing to bend over to help any student. Her classes are engaging, and are easy A's if you attend and participate. One of the best profs I've had at SFU! If you're interested in Spanish, or just want to learn a language for fun, or even just for credit take her class

She is a nice teacher. I took this class last summer. I have to say that she tried very hard to make students fully understand in Spanish Essay writing. This is a writing-intensive class. So be prepared to write a lot of essays.

She's really great! If you are wanting to take a spanish course, take it wish Isabel. She is very helpful and fair and she actually cares if people understand the stuff or not. Her tests are taken on the computer and are pretty easy if you read the textbook and practice.
awesome prof. super nice. she looks scary but is actually not mean at all. Tests are not that hard if you keep up in class and read the textbook.

Easy going mexican teacher. extreme online activities with enough time.exams are between fair and hard.she encourages you to speak in class.she doesn't give you hard time during lectures which is important.
